item.title: Enfield council ghettoising the borough, 19th October
item.description:
I have reported the unlicensed multi occupancy, at 36 Lytton Avenue, where men arrive each day in vans, sneaking no English. Make of that what you will. The council knows this yet agreed an extension for more unlicensed multi occupants . The street is now full of lone males, parking vans on the grass verges and across the pavements illegally. Again the council know this. They have put up the most unstable scaffolding, balancing tenuously at the edge of the wall and jutting into and damaging the streets trees - which the council have a disregard of. All n all Enfield council are decimating the borough, which is now lawless.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lytton Avenue, Palmers Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipping and Rubbish on Badgemore Path, 19th October
item.description:
I would like to report an ongoing issue with fly-tipping and rubbish along Badgemore Path. The path is often littered with trash in the bushes, sometimes even suitcases, but more often general waste and disgusting debris. This is especially concerning because the path surrounds the school, and it is upsetting that children are exposed to this every day. Not only does it create an unpleasant and unhealthy environment, but it also risks normalising this behaviour for them, which could encourage the same habits in the future. Please could this be investigated and action taken to address the issue on a regular basis? Thank you for your attention.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgemore Path, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish bin parking permit, 19th October
item.description:
Several residents on this street are regularly placing household rubbish bins in resident permit bays to reserve parking spaces. This obstructs fair use of the bays and creates unnecessary clutter and hazards. The bins are often left out for extended periods, even outside of collection days. This misuse of public space undermines the resident permit system and causes tension among neighbours. Please investigate and take appropriate action to discourage this behaviour.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goldsworthy Gardens, London
Report on FixMyStreet
